hanzi-su-wiki:

Гриб; микроб, бактерия

Мнемоника

Плесень похожа на крошечную травку 艹 и поражает амбары 口, где хранятся злаковые культуры 禾.

rtega_mnemonic:
菌菌RSmushroom, germ, microbe
  • type of plant 艹 that grows on old grain in the granary 囷
purpleculture_info: Pictophonetic: 囷 indicates the sound; 艹 (plant) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
细菌 [ xì jūn ]: bacterium; germ
病菌 [ bìng jūn ]: harmful bacteria; pathogenic bacteria; germs
杀菌 [ shā jūn ]: to kill germs; to disinfect; to sterilize
杆菌 [ gǎn jūn ]: bacillus (any rod-shaped bacteria)
真菌 [ zhēn jūn ]: fungi; fungus
伞菌 [ sǎn jùn ]: agaric
马勃菌 [ mǎ bó jùn ]: puffball (mushroom in the division Basidiomycota)
松菌 [ sōng jùn ]: matsutake (Tricholoma matsutake), edible mushroom considered a great delicacy in Japan
食菌 [ shí jùn ]: edible mushroom
菌伞 [ jùn sǎn ]: mushroom top
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿱ Above to below
    • 艹 [ cǎo ] grass, weed, plant, herb
    • 囷 [ qūn ] a round bin for storing grain
heisig_chinese_memo: Imagine the wheat pent in your fridge growing to the point where they resemble fungus with flowers on top.
heisig_constituent: germ, flowers, pent in, wheat, cereal
koohiiStory1: Can also mean bacteria.....imagine the wheat pent in your fridge growing to the point where they resemble flowers.......I actually had something similar happen to onions...they grew footlong legs after about 2 or 3 years......OR just think of that Cowboy Bebop episode with the lobster in the fridge... :-).
koohiiStory2: Actually it means germs as in microorganisms. So for example, you have to keep wheat enclosed so it isn´t exposed to other plants. That way it can´t catch any germs (like fungi) from them.
jp_example_words:
細菌(さいきん): bacillus, bacterium, germ
黴菌(ばいきん): bacteria, germ(s)
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: When you leave grains in your mouth for long enough, they'll turn into flowers of bacteria. These aren't the nice, pretty flowers you'd give your mom on Mother's Day. These are little bacteria flowers that are taking over your mouth. Maybe brush your teeth next time.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine how much bacteria would flower in your mouth if you just left grains in there for like, I dunno, a month. That's a lot of nasty bacteria!
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: There is a lot of this bacteria in the King (きん) of England's mouth. He eats a lot of grains, and he won't let anyone touch his mouth to clean it, but he refuses to do things himself... so it's absolutely chock full of bacteria.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Picture the King's mouth up close. Look at all the bacteria squiggling around and through his teeth and gums. Bleh! Barf!
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the granary (囷) with grass (艹) on top breeds germs
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Imagine the wheat pent in your fridge growing to the point where they resemble fungus with flowers on top.
humanum_full_description_en:
From the sound of "艸" and "囷", the original meaning is mushroom and fungus. "Shuowen": "Earth mushrooms. From the foot, the sound." Jia Sixie of the Northern Wei Dynasty "Qi Min Yaoshu‧ Vegetarian": "Mushroom, a free-range chicken. The mouth is not opened, the inside and outside are all white. It's so stinky to eat."

" Bacteria " can mean a gloomy appearance. "Selected Works‧Ma Rong "Flute Fu"": "Fulfills the rhythm of the depression, and the stubborn fungus." Li Shan's note: "All the voices are the appearance of the competition.
humanum_short_description_en: From the sound of "艸" and "囷", the original meaning is mushroom and fungus.
humanum_full_description:
從「艸」，「囷」聲，本義為蕈、菌子。《說文》：「地蕈也。从艸，囷聲。」 北魏賈思勰《齊民要術‧素食》：「菌，一名地雞。口未開，內外全白者佳；其口開裏黑者，臭不堪食。」

　　「菌」可表示鬱結貌。《文選‧馬融〈長笛賦〉》：「充屈鬱律，瞋菌碨柍。」李善注：「皆眾聲鬱積競出之貌。」
humanum_short_description: 從「艸」，「囷」聲，本義為蕈、菌子。

From the sound of " 艸" and " 囷", the original meaning is mushroom and fungus. "Shuowen": "Earth mushrooms. From the foot, the sound." Jia Sixie of the Northern Wei Dynasty "Qi Min Yaoshu‧ Vegetarian": "Mushroom, a free-range chicken. The mouth is not opened, the inside and outside are all white. It's so stinky to eat." " Bacteria" can mean a gloomy appearance. "Selected Works‧Ma Rong "Flute Fu"": "Fulfills the rhythm of the depression, and the stubborn fungus." 菌字的基本解释

菌
jūn
低等植物的一大类，不开花，没有茎和叶子，不含叶绿素，不能自己制造养料，过寄生生活，种类繁多：细菌。真菌。病菌。菌肥。

菌
jùn
　ㄐㄩㄣˋ
即“蕈”。

菌字的汉语字典释义

[①]［jùn］
［《廣韻》渠殞切，上軫，羣。］
［《廣韻》求晚切，上阮，羣。］
亦作“蔨2”。
(1)蕈，菌子。
(2)郁结貌。
(3)隐蔽。
(4)通“箘”。竹；竹笋。
[②]［jūn］
不含光合作用色素，以寄生或腐生方式摄取有机物质为营养的异养性原核生物或真核生物。是生物界的低级类群。习惯上包括细菌、粘菌和真菌三大类。

菌字的英文翻译

◎ 菌
bacterium, fungus, mushroom

菌字的康熙字典解释

【申集上】【艸字部】　菌； 康熙笔画：14； 页码：页1037第14
【唐韻】渠隕切，音窘。【說文】地蕈也。【爾雅·釋草】中馗，菌。【疏】此菌大小異名也，大者名中馗，小者名菌。【博物志】菌，食之有味，而常毒殺人。　又朝菌，槿也。【莊子·逍遙遊】朝菌不知晦朔。　又山名。【山海經】南海之內有菌山。　又菌蠢，芝貌。【張衡·南都賦】芝房菌蠢生其隈。　又【集韻】區倫切，音皸。菌桂出交趾，員如竹。【屈原·離騷】雜申椒與菌桂兮。　又【博雅】菌，薰也。其葉謂之蕙。【素問】肝氣虛，則夢見菌香生草。　又【馬融·長笛賦】瞋菌碨柍。【註】皆衆聲鬱積競出之貌。　又【篇海】音郡。【淮南子·地形訓】海人生若菌，若菌生聖人。

菌字的源字形

菌字的起名意思

低等植物的一大类，不开花，没有茎和叶子，不含叶绿素，不能自己制造养料，靠寄生生活，种类很多如细菌、真菌等。

bacteria
Basic explanation of words
bacteria
jūn
A large category of lower plants that do not flower, have no stems and leaves, do not contain chlorophyll, cannot make their own nourishment, live a parasitic life, and have many types: bacteria. Fungus. Germs. Bacterial fertilizer.
bacteria
jùn
ㄐ ㄩ ㄣ ˉ
Namely "Mushroom".
bacteria
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［jùn］
["Guang Yun" Qu died cut, Shang Zhen, group. ]
["Guangyun" Seek late cut, go to Ruan, group. ]
Also known as "蔨2".
(1) Mushrooms, fungus seeds.
(2) Slumping appearance.
(3) Concealment.
(4) Through "箘". Bamboo; bamboo shoots.
[②]［jūn］
Heterotrophic prokaryotes or eukaryotes that do not contain photosynthetic pigments and consume organic substances as nutrients by parasitic or saprophytic methods. It is a low-level group in the biological world. It is customary to include three types of bacteria, slime molds and fungi.
bacteria

◎ Bacteria
bacterium, fungus, mushroom
bacteria

bacteria
Source glyph
bacteria
Name meaning
A large category of lower plants, which do not flower, have no stems and leaves, do not contain chlorophyll, cannot make their own nourishment, and live on parasites. There are many types such as bacteria and fungi.
形声字。艸(+)表意,篆书形体像草,表示菌是低等植物的一类;困(qun)表声,困是古代圆形谷仓,表示菌的形体圆
如困。本义是伞菌类植物。引申为细菌。
Ojin 蕈(xdn),指某些高等菌类植物,形状像伞,有的
可吃。Ojan 寄生微生物:细~「病~「真~。
O~子 香~ 0~核 ~类 毒~ 杀~ 霉~
菌
jùn / jūn
菌
菌,
Пиктофонетические символы.
Qun (+) означает, что форма письма печати похожа на траву, что означает, что гриб является разновидностью низшего растения; Qun означает звук, который представляет собой древний круглый сарай, что означает, что форма гриба круглая. как сонный.
Первоначальное значение - растения-поганки.
Распространяется на бактерии.
Гриб Одзин (xdn) относится к некоторым высшим грибам, имеющим форму зонтиков, а некоторые из них съедобны.
Паразитические микроорганизмы Оджана: нормально ~ "больные ~" верно ~.
О ~ Цзысян ~ 0 ~ Ядерное ~ Ядовитое ~ Убивающее ~ Плесень ~
бактерии
jn / jūn
бактерии
бактерии
jūn, jùn
I, jūn
1) грибок, плесень; ржавчина (на растениях); с.-х. мучнистая роса, мильдью (грибок на винограде)
酵母菌 дрожжевой гриб
2) микроб, бактерия, бацилла
奈瑟氏菌 мед. бацилла Нейссера, гонококк
II, jùn
гриб; съедобные грибы
Radicals: 艹, 口, 禾  (flowers, mouth, grain)
Meaning Mnemonic
When you leave grains in your mouth for long enough, they'll turn into flowers of bacteria. These aren't the nice, pretty flowers you'd give your mom on Mother's Day. These are little bacteria flowers that are taking over your mouth. Maybe brush your teeth next time.
Imagine how much bacteria would flower in your mouth if you just left grains in there for like, I dunno, a month. That's a lot of nasty bacteria!
Reading Mnemonic
There is a lot of this bacteria in the King (きん) of England's mouth. He eats a lot of grains, and he won't let anyone touch his mouth to clean it, but he refuses to do things himself... so it's absolutely chock full of bacteria.
Picture the King's mouth up close. Look at all the bacteria squiggling around and through his teeth and gums. Bleh! Barf!
